name: Emotional Resilience Exercises
description: Practical exercises to build emotional resilience against manipulative psychological tactics.

cards.title: Breaking Emotional Hooks
cards.description: Training your mind to resist emotional coercion and guilt manipulation.
bulletpoints: Identifying common emotional hooks used by PSNs to create dependency.
Using cognitive distancing techniques to break emotional attachment.
Practicing emotional disengagement when faced with manipulative guilt-tripping.
cards.summaryText: Spot the hook, step back mentally, and drop the guilt line before it snags you.

cards.title: Controlled Emotional Numbing
cards.description: Temporarily suppressing emotions to avoid being manipulated in high-stakes interactions.
bulletpoints: Activating detachment mode to neutralize emotional influence.
Practicing stoicism as a defensive strategy against manipulation.
Building a switchable emotional buffer for resilience in long-term engagements.
cards.summaryText: Flip on detachment, wear stoic armor, and keep a buffer you can toggle at will.

cards.title: Mental Reframing for Emotional Control
cards.description: Using cognitive restructuring to reduce emotional impact.
bulletpoints: Turning insults into neutral statements to prevent emotional reactions.
Redirecting guilt and shame-based manipulation back onto the aggressor.
Using thought-stopping techniques to prevent emotional spiraling.
cards.summaryText: Reframe their barbs, bounce guilt back, and cut spirals off mid-thought.
